definition: to share the booty/to divide ill-gotten gains
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
stolen goods/booty/spoils

sentences.english: The thieves quarrel (l)ed with one another about how to divide the loot.
sentences.chinese: 小偷們爲如何分贓而互相爭吵。

sentences.english: What nation hath not inherited her kingdom, and gotten of her spoils?
sentences.chinese: 那一個民族沒有佔領過這國土，沒有來劫掠分贓？

sentences.english: The accomplice of a thief is his own enemy.
sentences.chinese: 與盜賊分贓，是恨惡自己的性命。

sentences.english: I was very dusty and dirty and went up to my room to wash .
sentences.chinese: 我滿身塵土十分贓，於是，上樓到我房間裏去洗一下。

sentences.english: The robbers decided to whack up the profits from the robbery.
When they got to their forest hide-out they divided up the loot.
sentences.chinese: 他們回到森林裏的藏身處分贓。

definition: (Tw) to buy off influential people (in an election, a call for tenders etc)
pier foundation (architecture)/(Tw) politically influential figure enlisted to support one side in an election
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
fight to the death/desperate struggle
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
dictatorship
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
interest group
administrative authority/executive power
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
Marxism-Leninism
inexperienced/junior (employee etc)
to form a clique
political enemy/opponent
